title: Linear and rotational motion - insect on cone

content.question: A solid, uniform cone is spinning with constant angular speed about a vertical axis through its center of mass, as shown. A small insect is initially standing on the surface of the cone at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. At a later time, the insect has moved to Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following statements about the motion of the insect is true?

choices.label: The angular speed of the insect is greater at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The angular speed of the insect is greater at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

The linear speed of the insect is greater at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

The linear speed of the insect is greater at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> than at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.

content.answer: The linear speed of the insect is greater at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> than at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
